snippet: For years, Congress found its way around rules meant to control deficits, but trillion-dollar deficits and a new core of spending hawks are beginning to change that.
abstract: Growing mood of austerity in Washington, spurred by trillion-dollar deficits, has begun to turn legislating into a zero-sum game; highway, student loan and flood insurance bill cut $700 million from a mine-closure fund that had long been a piggy bank for Western states; many lawmakers fear their own pet projects may be next.
lead_paragraph: For years, Congress found its way around rules meant to control deficits, but trillion-dollar deficits and a new core of spending hawks are beginning to change that.

headline.seo: Washington’s New Austerity Spreads Around the Pain
headline.main: In Washington’s New Mood of Austerity, Legislating Turns Into a Zero-Sum Game
headline.print_headline: In Washington’s New Mood of Austerity, Legislating Turns Into a Zero-Sum Game
